headline: Synopsys Just the Latest to Strike a Deal With Nvidia. What It Means for the Stock.
summary: Nvidia  said Monday that it had taken a $2 billion stake in  Synopsys  part of an expanded partnership that could see artificial intelligence play a bigger role in industrial design and engineering.  Synopsys stock rose 4.9% to $438.29 on Monday, while shares of Nvidia, the leading maker of chips for artificial intelligence, rose 1.7% to $179.92.  Nvidia said it had invested $2 billion in Synopsys common stock at a purchase price of $414.79 a share.

Nvidia said it had invested $2 billion in Synopsys common stock at a purchase price of $414.79 a share.

headline: Circular Financing Worries Surround Nvidia
summary: Fiona Cincotta, senior analyst from City Index, says worries around Nvidia's circular financing are here to stay as they announced a $2 billion investment in Synopsys. She speaks with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech."

headline: AI: Late 2026 will be inflection point for these hyperscalers
summary: Nvidia (NVDA) announced a $2 billion investment in chip software manufacturer Synopsys (SNPS), while OpenAI (OPAI.PVT) takes an ownership stake in Thrive Holdings and strikes a deal to be Accenture's (ACN) primary artificial intelligence partner. Bloomberg Intelligence Senior Semiconductor Analyst Kunjan Sobhani chats with Allie Canal about the AI trade in the context of "circular investing" concerns and his outlook on which hyperscalers may have opportunities to pull ahead of the competition in 2026. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Nvidia Buys $2B of Synopsys Stock, DeepSeek Debuts New AI Models
summary: Nvidia Corp. invested $2 billion in Synopsys Inc. as part of a broader engineering and design tie-up, aiming to infuse its AI-computing technology into more industries. The new partnership involves integrating Nvidia's tools into Synopsys' chip-design applications, and the companies will deploy AI agents and work on joint marketing. While elsewhere, DeepSeek unveiled two new versions of an experimental artificial-intelligence model aimed at rivaling Google and OpenAI. 'Bloomberg Tech' Co-host Ed Ludlow joined Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to break it all down.

While elsewhere, DeepSeek unveiled two new versions of an experimental artificial-intelligence model aimed at rivaling Google and OpenAI. 'Bloomberg Tech' Co-host Ed Ludlow joined Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to break it all down.
